aman_holding_line: ^Over the past two weeks, we have received so much love from the community. Thousands of you have played it and shared such thoughtful and heart-felt responses to the game thus far.

^We have only released the initial chapters of two characters, and there’s much more to their stories, and many more characters on the way. I am excited for you to play them and to feel empathy for their journeys too.

^However, there are some in the Sikh community who felt that the way in which one of our characters, Aman Singh, was presented was not respectful. They have given strong feedback to us and requested that we consider changing key parts of the story.

^We hear their concerns, and are in close consultation with the leaders of that community to address the issues. Allow us to also explain the philosophy behind the game and the way in which our stories are written.
^ToBeYou's purpose is to share the experiences of different groups of Singaporeans, including the different experiences of people within a particular group.
^We hope that through exploring powerful identity dilemmas,  users will appreciate the complexity behind the choices others make, and engender empathy and goodwill for those around them.

^Firstly, our stories are written after substantial research. We do open source reading, we have an academic Research Advisor, and we hold multiple focus group discussions with members of the community.
^Our writers and editors are also closely connected to the community, and most are from those communities themselves.
^We do not put any value judgement on the choices that real people make, and we try to represent their dilemmas in our stories.
^Secondly, our game is designed to explore different pathways that a person from that group may take. There are deliberately no right or wrong answers, no winning or losing outcomes, as in life.
^The pathways are deliberately designed to allow players to explore a variety of choices that shape the character, and mirror the diversity we see even within a community group.
^We do not favour or promote one pathway over the other.

^The choices that players make early in the game have consequences that will be played out in later chapters, and this is an important element of the story. Some of the choices that the character makes in the early chapters will have real and serious consequences later on.

^The objective of this is to let players experience those dilemmas first hand, and in the process, gain empathy for people who have a different identity, or have chosen pathways different from theirs.
^The purpose of this game is for us to gain empathy for people unlike ourselves, even though this may make us feel uncomfortable at times.
^At no point during the research, design, or development of the game and the story did we seek to undermine, judge, or challenge any belief system,  practice, or community.
^Our hope is to represent the lived experiences of real people, and to cherish them as human beings even if we disagree with their choices.
^It is difficult, but for Singapore to be better, we must learn to understand and accept these differences between people, even from within the same community.
^Aman Singh will be back soon. Thank you for your support and patience.
aman_1_intro: ^Sat Sri Akaal! (Sikh greeting: True is the Immortal one!)
^I’m Amandeep Singh Sahota. I usually go by Aman (peaceful one).
^Just like my sister’s name is Prabhjot (light of God), but we call her Jothi.
^Tomorrow, I’m enlisting in NS. I’ll spend the next nine weeks rolling around in mud and sweat.
^My friend Zhihao - we grew up as neighbours - has spent months telling me how horrible it’s going to be.
^Because of the NS thing, Mum has been hovering over me a lot lately. I hope she’ll be okay...
^What with me going into NS, and Jothi marrying her fiance Kirpal soon.
^It’s not just her - even Papa-ji popped by my room unexpectedly the other night and said ‘Goodnight, son.’
^And of course, my girlfriend Selinder has been very sweet to me.
^I know we’re both young, but I’m starting to think what Sel and I have is long-term.
^After NS, I’m off to university to study business administration.
^Even though what I really want to do is…
^Never mind. I can’t even say it yet.
^And this is what it’s like, to be me.

g-0: ^😡 don’t you have a Twitch stream to attend to?
^and i can’t imagine, with a turban

aman_1_1a: ^Aman? Are you done packing? Do you have everything you need, beta? (Term of endearment for child, or son.)
^The government website says to bring extra underwear, you know. I went to research.
^If it’s not important, the government wouldn’t say EXTRA.
^Yes mum, I have hills of underwear. Mountains.
^You are so cheeky to your mum. Where do you learn all these bad things?

c-0: ^ People say I take after you, don’t they?
^Nonsense, you look just like your Papa-ji.
^You and he are more alike than you think.
^Yes, but you have the same stubbornness inside.
c-1: ^ Jothi has corrupted me with her bad influence.
^Have you said goodbye to your sister yet?
^She was on the phone with Kirpal, but she said she’ll come say goodnight later.
^Ooh, they must be doing wedding planning.
^Yes, I heard something about booking a slot at the gurdwara (Sikh temple).
^Only six months left - they need to book right now or they will never get the slot they want.
^I don’t know why this generation always likes to leave things late.

aman_1_1b: ^Tomorrow our Aman is going into NS. We are all proud of him.
^What is Papa-ji doing? This is so unlike him. He never makes these grand speeches, let alone about me.
^🙏🏽 A noble time of life. Aman, remember that Sikhs have always been warriors and defenders. It is in our blood, in our history as a martial people. Do us proud!
^Wow, it can’t get more stressful than that.
^In fact, I am sure you will make it into OCS (Officer Cadet School). Just like our Harpreet!
^And don’t worry BMT is not that bad! haha
^Am sure you’ve been keeping fit etc
^I take it back, it just got worse. Uh...

g-0: ^I know you will do well, son.

aman_1_1c: ^Why are you tap-tap-tapping away again, beta? Always got side-business going on.
^Sorry, I had to reply to something. You’ll see later in the family chat with Uncle Ranjit and all. (sigh)
^You think I raised you for 19 years and don’t know how to read your face?
^I'm just worried about not doing well
^I'm worried about being the only Sikh there

c-0: ^  I just don’t want to disappoint you all.
^You know me, mum. I’m never the guy who’s the loudest in the room, or the one who assumes he should take charge.
^I’m not Mr “OK Let’s Go” like Harpreet, or -
^Do you think following the ways of the Khalsa (Sikh saint-soldiers) is about being Number One in the room?
^About how fast you run, or how much you can lift, or how many men salute you when you walk past them?
^But Papa-ji and Uncle Ranjit both did so well. Uncle Ranjit expects me to -
c-1: ^ No, but people do care about that kind of thing.
^Papa-ji and Uncle Ranjit both did so well in their time, and Uncle Ranjit especially -
g-0: ^Uncle Ranjit, Uncle Ranjit. Is Uncle Ranjit going with you to NS? Will you be taking him to Tekong in your backpack?
^You just focus on being yourself, and make sure you come home safely to me.

c-1: ^     Maybe it’s just the ‘new school’ feeling.
^Having to start in a new environment all over again, and being the odd one out.
^Like how everyone will be wearing helmets, and I’ll be only one keeping the turban.
^Is lying low what you want to do?
^Sorry, I know. I have to excel.
^I asked, what do you want to do?

c-0: ^Honestly, I just want to survive NS, mum.
^It’s all I want for you as well. To come home safe and sound.
c-1: ^I’d like to do well, if I can.
^I know NS is a big deal, and means a lot to Papa-ji…
^But I am not asking what Papa-ji wants.
^Never mind Aman, you think about it.
^Just make sure you come home to me safely.
c-2: ^Well, if you don’t know what you want.
g-0: ^As for worrying about being the odd one out. You know it is not your first time being unique, and it will not be your last time.
^Remember - Nirbhau (without fear), Nirvair (without hate). Maintain your chardikala (serenity regardless of adversity.)
^Just be yourself, and everything will fall into place. Because you are a good person. And a good son.
^Now, are you sure you have enough underwear? There’s more downstairs, just out of the laundry -
^Mum! Just let me finish packing okay? Goodnightttt.
^Okay, okay. Goodnight, beta. I love you.

aman_1_2_narration: ^Well, this is it. I’m on my own now.
^I can’t believe it was just hours ago that Papa-ji and Mum brought me to the ferry terminal, and we took the boat here.
^Turning in my NRIC for my 11B (military ID) felt like taking on a new life.
^After we ate lunch in the cookhouse, we said our goodbyes.
^Thankfully Mum didn’t make a big deal about it. Papa-ji just patted me on the shoulder and gave a nod.
^I miss Sel already. We only managed a few sweet messages and I-love-yous in the early morning hours. I wonder what she’s up to...
aman_1_2: ^Should I be saying yes, sir? Yes, sergeant? I should have looked up this stuff on Reddit.
^So is your surname Singh, or Sahota?

c-1: ^ Singh is my Sikh surname, Sahota is my ancestral name.
g-0: ^Firstly, you will address me as SERGEANT not SIR.
^If you forget it, you can read it on my name tag.
^If you forget how to read, then good luck to you.
^Inside your duffel bag, no helmet for you. Got green turban.
^Later, for the haircut. You are exempt. Just make sure you keep your hair neatly.
^If anyone asks you, why Recruit Singh so special? You can refer them to me.

c-2: ^Oh please, you believe? Refer them to me for what?
c-3: ^Wait ah, let me call my grandmother ask her…
^Please lah, you are how old? I’m sure you know how to handle your own life.

g-1: ^Okay, all your items are in order. Bring your things to your bunk.
^Think quick, before I look like a fool…
^Hey man, Section 3? Let’s go up together.
^Hey, this guy is pretty cheesy. We might get along.
^So I overheard just now - you don’t have to cut your hair?
^Oh! But you can still have short hair and keep your turban, right?
^No, hair is sacred in Sikhism, so underneath, my hair is long. I’ve literally never cut it.
^So... all Sikhs keep their hair long? How about the girls?
^Yes, the girls are supposed to keep their hair long as well. Uncut hair is called the ‘kesh’ and it’s one of the symbols of the faith we’re supposed to keep - we call it the five ‘K’s.
^But I guess like in every religion, there are differences, based on personal reasons. So not everyone keeps it long, like my sister.
^Oh, got it. Some Muslim men also believe they should keep facial hair, but I don’t.
^Are you worried about maintaining it in NS?
^Maybe, but I’ll figure it out. Anyway, you’ll be helping me tie my turban, so it’s fine.
^Okay set, you agreed! I’ll show you later!

aman_1_3_narration: ^The last week has been a blur.
^We wake at dawn, we train, we fall into our bunks at night.
^I manage to exchange a few messages with Sel most nights, before I sleep. It’s hard to talk much since I’m paranoid about running out of batt.
^I’ve tried to remember Mum’s advice. To be myself.
^It seems to be working out so far...
aman_1_3: ^Aman, don’t walk around with your hair like that leh.
^We all cannot sleep seeing your long hair in the dark, nearly to your waist. So scary!

aman_1_3a: ^(Singing) Everybody fling to the left, everybody fling to the right…
^Aman, teach me how to tie hair in a bun leh, next time I can do for my girlfriend.

b: ^Nirbhau (without fear), Nirvair (without hate), maintain my chardilaka (serenity regardless of adversity).
^Nirbhau (without fear), Nirvair (without hate), maintain my chardilaka (serenity regardless of adversity).

aman_1_3a: ^Thank god, they’re finally losing interest and walking away.
aman_1_3b: ^I didn’t know you were so easy to scare.
^You know my hair is long for religious reasons, right?
^Better don’t joke lah, wait Aman call police, say you anti- religious harmony.
^Wahhhh so serious. Okay Aman, don’t kill me. I have nothing against long hair...
aman_1_3ab: ^Yeah, I’m used to it. Same story since young, being teased. Happens all the time. I just thought people would be more mature in NS.
^I’m also not used to being around other people with my hair not covered. But my hair is wet, so what to do, right.
aman_1_3c: ^Oh, are they looking for a pontianak? I’ll give them something to remember.
^Let my eyes glaze over, slowly turn around…
^Ha! That was brilliant, dey. I was legit freaked out.
^Well, that seems to have settled them. Glad they’re turning their attention to something else now.
^Didn’t know you can act so well, man!
^When I saw you do that I was honestly shook.
^I can tell bro. You’re super talented!
^You shouldn’t have had to use it there though. Those guys were out of line.
^Yeah, I find that sometimes, humour is a useful way to just defuse the situation, when you don’t want to get into a fight.
^I was pissed off, but it’s not like I want to start anything on an island in the middle of nowhere.
^I’ve been teased about my turban since young, so all these - I guess you could call them coping mechanisms - are like second nature now.
^Right. But then they’ll never learn, and they’ll think you’re fine with it.
^They’d better not pull that crap again with me around, I tell you. Just because you’re a nice guy. They shouldn’t take advantage.

aman_1_3_lukmanchat: ^I’m really lucky to have a buddy.
^Hey, time to fold my turban to wear tomorrow. You want to help?
^Can. Wait, let me remember what you said… fold in half first, right?
^Now, hold tightly and I will fold towards you…
^I’m really glad you have my back in here.
^Don’t mention it. Anyway, you’ve had mine too.
^With you around, I don’t have to be the only one in our section who eats in the Halal area of the cookhouse. You don’t have to eat Halal food, but you accompany me.
^Well, it’s also because I’m not used to Chinese food...
^You’re always reminding me to hydrate when I push myself too hard.
^When I told you I wanted to try for OCS, you didn’t laugh or accuse me of trying to be wayang, but you said you thought I had potential.

^I don’t want to tell the rest about the OCS thing, they’d make fun of me for trying. Plus, my grades are okay but they’re not that high. And people also say it’s harder to get into some positions as a Malay-Muslim.
^Really? But I thought there are Malay fighter pilots and Generals?
^Yeah, there are some. It’s just... rare.
^To be fair, I think things are slowly getting better. At least now we can go on ships.
^But if you read comments about Muslims in the military online, it’s damn toxic. There are people who think we won’t be loyal to Singapore.
^So is it about my diet, or is it about my loyalty?
^I'm sure there are reasons for this

c-0: ^ It’s hard to understand, but I guess there must be reasons why some people came to think this way.
^Not saying they’re right at all, but mindsets take time to change.
^Maybe there’s a reason that makes sense to them generally. But it sucks because it makes no sense to me personally.
^My ancestors were probably here before this place was called Singapore.
c-1: ^ I’m sorry bro, things shouldn’t be this way.
^Loyalty to Singapore isn’t about race or religion. Mindsets should move on.
^This kind of thing can only change slowly.
^Then you see what generation you are born in, whether you are lucky or unlucky to suffer from this kind of mindset.
g-0: ^But this is my struggle to fight la. No use complaining tonight.
^Eh for you how? You haven’t said what you want - command school or slack?
^I haven’t decided yet. I mean, I’ll do what I can.
^Still early days. How about after NS?
^After? Er, I’m going into business school.
^You don’t sound so happy about that.
^Er, it’s okay lah. Honestly, if I could do something else, I might consider it.

c-2: ^ I’ve actually been thinking about trying… acting?
^Whoa. Not bad huh, Aman Got Talent.
^Hurr. Not sure about talent, but I’ve always been in drama since young.
^I like acting. People say I’m good at it, and I like how I feel when I do it.
^It’s going to sound really weird and philosophical.
^So… acting is about pretending to be someone else, right?
^But when I act, I feel like I’m being me.
^Like I’m putting myself on the line.
^The parts of me that feel the same emotions my character feels, think the same way my character thinks.
^In real life, we’re always presenting ourselves the way we want to be seen.
^When I’m acting, it’s like... I’m revealing the way I am, and the way I am is… seen.
c-3: ^What I would really want to do is act.
^After NS, the plan is to go for some casting calls, maybe do some headshots and demo reels…
^But I’m not ready to say all of that out loud.
^Work in progress, akan datang (coming soon) bro.

g-1: ^Crap, we talked until so late. Time to crash. (Yawns)
^You’re right. Goodnight! Let’s slay it tomorrow.
^Quick, turn on my phone. I can only spend 10 minutes max.

aman_1_3_selchat: ^Jaan (term of endearment) how was your day?
^Where do I even begin? I’m so exhausted…
^It was good bb, how about yours?
^Mine was OK, still waiting to hear back on jobs
^There’s one accounting position that looks possible
^And a couple of finance admin jobs in govt agencies
^You’re gonna be a career woman huh, way ahead of me…
^Don’t be silly jaan. Well, maybe at first
^But you are going to university remember, and doing business
^So you will be the big dollars man. 🤪

c-0: ^ Gotta work for my bb, I know
^I meant it about you being a career woman though, you shouldn’t hold yourself back at all while I’m stomping mud on this island
^I’m not sure I want that life though
^I definitely want to work. At least for now
^But it will also be nice to live a quiet life
^Every day go to langgar hall (Sikh communal kitchens, in gurdwaras) and volunteer
^No, I’m just dozing off, I’m incredibly tired…
^There’s no right or wrong about it, you just go for the life you want
^But I’m not sure I can give it to you…
^Never mind, it’s too early to think about that.
^... but I have to sleep now
c-1: ^ Oh? What if I don’t end up doing business in the end?
^What if I don’t earn any money?
^What if I become an actor and play a leading man in a romance drama with a v v pretty actress?
^Really, what a strange and highly specific question
^Do you have some life goals I don’t know about?

c-0: ^Well, nothing in stone, but I was thinking of taking acting a little further
^I know you are v v good, I’ve seen all your performances
^But jaan… professionally? That’s a big step
^I shouldn’t have started this conversation, I can’t finish it tonight.
^It sounds like she has doubts, I don’t blame her.
^We can talk about it more, but I really have to sleep now
c-1: ^I thought I knew you completely jaan 😭
^I shouldn’t have said anything, now I can’t finish telling her.
^My only goals right now are to make you smile
^😍😍 I didn’t know in NS they teach you all the sweet things
^No jaan these things come naturally to me
^Ok sorry bb, I have to sleep.

aman_1_4_narration: ^There were bad days, worse days, and a few good ones sprinkled around.

b: ^I tried to keep a low profile for the most part, but being the only one with a turban made that tough.
^I pushed myself to do well, and I did - but it was hard, and there were days I felt like giving up.
^I wasn't sure what I wanted to achieve coming into NS, so I mostly just focused on surviving it.

aman_1_4_narration: ^This selfie was a happy memory - my parents and Sel came by for my Passing Out Parade after BMT.
^I became a combat medic. I didn't make it to OCS, but I got promoted to be a Third Sergeant!

b: ^Being the only Sikh in my platoon wasn't easy, but some people had it much harder than I did.
^I guess I didn't need to be worried about not doing well - NS was about proving myself to me, not to others.

aman_1_4_narration: ^I think it worked out for the best. Being a medic felt right to me.
^Lukman didn’t get into OCS either. But he worked hard as a Transport Operator and eventually got his 3SG rank, same as me.
^Jothi got married to Kirpal mid-way and moved in with him. I weirdly miss having her around home on the weekends.
^But we still see each other often, and she joins us for dinner sometimes.
^My last day of NS was yesterday. I'm a free man today. And it feels... liberating!
^But I'll need to start confronting my future now, which is something I've been putting off.
^First, it's time to celebrate with the family. I'm hungry!
aman_1_4: ^Papa-ji and Mum really pulled out all the stops just to celebrate my ORD (Operationally Ready Date).
^You are a senior medic who saves lives!
^Mum, your voice is a bit uh, loud...
^(Loudly) Fellow diners, my son has served his NS!
^(Even more loudly) And his biceps are STILL BIGGER THAN HIS BRAIN!
^Papa-ji hasn’t said much tonight. But he’s always quiet, hard to read.
^I wonder if he wishes I had gotten into OCS instead?
^When I told him I was assigned to SCS (Specialist Cadet School) to be a medic, he just nodded and went back to his newspaper.
^Our Aman has big biceps and excellent brains. That’s why Selinder is hanging on to him.
^Mum, it’s more like the other way around.
^Behave yourself, beta. How old are you already, and still bullying your brother like you are teenagers.
^I married out of the house, mummy. Now I rarely get to make Aman suffer, so I must maximise every chance I get. How is this not intuitive?

c-0: ^ My dear sister, you seem to be going through a dark time.
^Is your mid-life crisis everything you thought it would be?
c-1: ^ Boy, Kirpal must have a fun married life.
^And I must have fun while I skewer you with this for -
g-0: ^Children! Mera ser na kayi ja (“Stop eating my head”)!
^I’m proud of you, chote veer (younger brother).
^Where’s Selinder, by the way? I thought she was supposed to join us tonight?
^She says she’s sorry, she wanted to have dinner with us, but her whole team is staying back so she felt like she couldn’t leave.
^Aw, so sad. Same story for Kirpal. I think Kirpal might join us for dessert though. He has a sweet tooth!
^But didn’t you say Selinder was miserable at her job? She’s still there?
^Yes, she always says once she can afford to quit, she’ll quit. She’s not a fan of corporate life.
^I don’t get it. I love working. I couldn’t stand to be home all day.
^Not working doesn’t mean she’ll be at home all day.
^Sel is just a quiet soul, she’d rather spend her time doing her own things and volunteering.
^No, don’t get me wrong, more power to her. Oh look - our food is here.
^Everything is delicious - parathas, shahi paneer, tandoori aloo.
^The silence is comfortable, as we eat. Enjoying good food, in good company, on a good night...
^You have some months before university starts. You should make good use of your time.
^But I can’t tell him that, right? He’s not going to think that’s a good use of time.

c-2: ^ I haven’t really made plans, Papa-ji.
^Yes, I won’t be idle, I will be doing… things.
c-3: ^ Just this and that, Papa-ji. Side-projects.

chapter_1_ending_1: ^I know this may be a surprise, but I was thinking of trying out some professional acting.
^I can’t read Papa-ji’s face at all.
^Yes, I was thinking of auditioning for some plays, or television work. I like acting, and I.. I’m good at it. So I would like to try.
^Well, this sounds like a terrible idea.
^What do you mean, why? Isn’t it obvious?
^How many roles do you think are out there for people who look like you?
^Yes Aman, people who look like you.
^Who keep the kesh. Who wear turbans. With brown skin.
^It’s hard enough to find roles for minorities, you think you’ll be able to find roles for minorities-within-minorities?
^It’s not like I hadn’t thought about this at all before.
^But I thought Jothi, of all people, would support me on this.
^I’m sorry Aman, you know me, I’m just being honest.
^I’m your sister and I can’t lie to you. You are going to have a very tough time.
^Beta, I’m sorry, I was just very surprised.
^We all knew you were talented, but we thought it was just a hobby.
^I believe in you, son. And Jothi, you should be more supportive of your brother.

c-0: ^ It’s fine mum, Jothi is just saying what she thinks.
^She’s not entirely wrong, I’m not an idiot. I just want to try.
^If I never fail then I’ll never succeed!
^Is that all he’s going to say?
c-1: ^ No, she’s not obliged to agree with my choices. And I know I’ll have a tough time.
^You’re wrong though, Jothi - it’s not a terrible idea. It’s just an idea you don’t agree with.
^But this is my path and I’m going to pursue it.
^And you are in for a surprise.
^Enough, Jothi, this is for Aman to choose.
g-0: ^Son, we support you no matter what. Go ahead and try. Just give it your best.

chapter_1_ending_2: ^Could I sound any more pathetic? Someone rescue me.
^You should spend more time with Selinder, beta.
^You’ve lasted three years already, and she has stayed with you since you were schoolmates, all throughout NS.
^She’s a good girl. And I like her parents too, they always say hello to us at the gurdwara.

c-0: ^I don’t like that look in mum’s eye. Like she’s counting the years between imaginary grandkids.
^Then Aman, you must take the next few years very seriously.
^Study hard, and get yourself established. Then you can take the next step.
^Yes. If you are serious, don’t make the girl wait too long.
^Never mind. It’s too late to say anything.
c-1: ^I like her a lot, but I know we’re still young.
^Oh, your Papa-ji and I were young when we got married. Well, he was older, but I was only twenty-two. That’s why I’m still young now.
^Although, the two of you have given me many grey hairs before my time.
^Well. Think about it, son. You are young, but already a man.
^So if you are serious about the girl, then be serious with your life.
^But I am! I’m serious about acting.
g-0: ^I’ll just have to do this on my own.

aman_2_intro: ^A month has flown by since I completed NS, and uni is around the corner.
^Each night I search for casting calls, and I’ve applied for dozens and dozens of roles...
^‘Sorry, we need a more relatable look.’

b: ^It’s hard to think that Jothi might be right.
^But I tell myself it’s early days, too early to give up.
^Maybe it’s a good thing I didn’t tell my family about this.
^If they don’t know I’m trying, they don’t have to know I’m failing.

aman_2_1_narration: ^It’s just sad that all this has eaten into my time with Sel. She deserves better.
^It’s a beautiful day on the beach, and I can’t even focus on her fully.
aman_2_1: ^Jaan? What are you looking at on your phone?

aman_2_1_1a: ^Yes jaan, don’t worry about it. Today is just about you and me.
^Aww, thank you. I’ve really needed this.
^Just… this. Being here. On a beach. With you. Away from things.
^I think I’m really not cut out for this job.
^I’m working late into the night, every single night, taking on duties that are way over my head.
^They say they want to ‘stretch’ my potential, but they clearly don’t want to ‘stretch’ my pay.
^They use the fact that I’m a Poly grad to justify it, you know? They say it’s ‘market rate for Poly grads’ - like, come on. Why can’t they pay me ‘market rate’ for my performance?
^And my boss. She expects me to read her mind, and she gets mad if I don’t.
^She’s always coming after me about the smallest things. The other day she said she wants me to start meeting clients, so I should try to look more ‘presentable’ and ‘modern’.
^She started dropping hints about hair salons and places where you can get your eyebrows trimmed. And she kept sneaking these weird looks at my kara (steel bangle, Sikh article of faith).
^Seriously? Did you explain it to her?
^No, it was all very subtle, you know? Nothing that I could really point to. Like she didn’t outright ask me to cut my hair or change my dressing. So I didn’t want to come across as over-sensitive.
^She’s always saying she has no tolerance for bad attitudes. I don’t want to be on her hitlist.
^This sounds like such a toxic work environment.
^I know right, what era is this?
^You should look for a different job. It’s not right.
^Well, you know the money makes a difference for my family so I can’t just quit. But I’m applying around.
aman_2_1_1b: ^Sorry, I was just looking at these casting calls.
^Oh, you mean you’re still applying for those?
^Sorry - I know you tried for one last week and it didn’t work out, so I thought that was that.
^Which one is she talking about? I applied for like twenty roles last week.
^I guess you won’t get to do this sort of thing once uni starts, so it’s good that you’re trying now.

c-0: ^I’ll just be glad to have your attention again. I feel like you’ve been so distracted.
c-1: ^I’m not actually planning to stop, jaan.
^Really? How will you balance it with school?
^I’ll be okay, I can juggle my time.
^Of course. Where is this coming from?
^Well it just seems like lately, we’ve barely had time together. I thought everything would get better after your NS, but it hasn’t.

aman_2_1_2: ^Elsa: Hi Aman this is Elsa from Everyday Productions. Tks for your pics and showreel. We took a look and the showreel is strong.
^Yes - they liked it! This is promising.

c-0: ^ Hold on one sec, sorry. It’s a casting agent! She’s still typing...

b: ^Oh wow! I didn’t know you were still applying for auditions. Yes, better reply quickly.
^Boy, she sounds unhappy about something. I’ll figure it out later.
^Are you sure? You looked so excited. Who’s the other woman?
^Oi, don’t be cheeky! It’s a casting agent!
^I’m kidding, jaan. I didn’t even realise you were still applying for auditions! You better check it, maybe it’s good news.
^Ok, then just give me a second.

aman_2_1_2b: ^Okay. Hey, you want to go wade in the water?
^I wonder what that Elsa lady is typing.
^It looks nice out there, not too crowded for a Saturday. Oh, then we go biking, and have brunch, and - how about a movie after that?
^I’ve been meaning to see that new horror movie for so long, what’s it called…
^The reviews are not bad. Do you know the one I’m talking about?
^I saw her first message, so she’ll see the blue-tick. I hope she doesn’t get offended by the delay in replying…
^Okay, then what did I say we should do next?

c-0: ^Go wading, have brunch, then go biking.
^Is this a test? It’s a bit childish don’t you think?
^I can’t believe this. Okay, you should check your messages, those aren’t childish.
c-1: ^Go wading, then go biking, then have brunch.
^Yes, fine. You were listening. Everything is perfect. Go check your messages.
g-0: ^If you don’t mind, I think I will.

aman_2_1_3: ^Hi Aman this is Elsa from Everyday Productions. Tks for your pics and showreel. We took a look and the showreel is strong.
^Hi Elsa, thanks, that’s great to hear.
^We hv shortlisted you for auditions, but need to check with you something first. It’s a corporate video so the client wants a very clean look. You ok to shave?
^What does she even mean by a ‘clean’ look? Do I look dirty?

c-0: ^ ... but that is not possible for me, for religious reasons.
c-1: ^ Please let me know if there are future roles for me that do not require me to change my look.
g-0: ^You sure? Tbh your reel was v strong. Better than most.

aman_2_1_3a: ^Is everything alright? You don’t look happy.
^Oh, just another rejection. Sorry you’re stuck with such a loser.
^Don’t talk about yourself like that, jaan. I don’t date losers.
^I know she said that to make me feel better, but I kind of feel worse…
^But I don’t want to be a downer. Sel has her own problems, and it’s not fair to overload her with mine. She’s the one who needs some cheering up.
^Now that you mention it. You’re my girlfriend, so that makes me a winner. Let’s get on with our date!
aman_2_1_3b: ^You sure? Do you need to text some more?
^You know, you’re not being very fair. What’s the problem here?
^Where do I start? I have a lot of problems Aman, but you have no time to hear them. I’ve been dealing with a lot of crap at work and you’re not mentally present enough to ask me how my week went.
^I’ve been waiting and looking forward to this date for a long time but I am starting to ask myself if I’ve been waiting for nothing.

c-0: ^ Jaan, I’m sorry. I should have paid you more attention.
^I hate my job, that’s all. But I don’t really want to talk about it now.
^Yes, I’m not in the mood. Let’s just walk, okay?
c-1: ^Now you’re just twisting my words! I didn’t mean it that way!
^I meant I’m right here but your mind is elsewhere, Aman! You’re so wrapped up in this acting nonsense, it’s getting you so upset, and I just feel like it’s not worth it!
^Okay, maybe that was the wrong word, but you get what I mean…
^No, I get what you mean. You think it’s nonsense.
^I mean, not *nonsense*, but compared to business school, don’t you think it’s a bit…
^Aman... I’m sorry. Does this really mean so much to you?
^Let’s just keep walking, Sel. We can talk about it another day.

aman_2_1_3c: ^Are you okay? Doesn’t look like good news.
^Just another rejection, I’m getting used to it now.
^Hey... I’m sorry I snapped at you earlier. I know you were trying your best. I’ve just had a really crappy week.
^I’m sorry too. I was trying to focus, I swear… Maybe I’m taking this acting thing too far, I don’t even know what I’m trying to prove anymore.
^Wait, why did you have a crappy week?
^Just my lousy job being lousy - we can talk about it another time. But jaan… can I ask you a question?

b: ^I know how much effort you put into your performances, and I always think you are truly amazing on stage. Not just because I’m your girlfriend.
^But what I mean is, are you going to try and act for a living?
^Remember way back when you were doing your BMT, and we would WhatsApp frantically at night before your batt ran out?
^I remember that one time, you kind of hinted that you might want to do acting seriously. Even for a living. Even instead of business.

aman_2_1_3c: ^Right now, I’m just trying to land one small break, take it one step at a time.
^But yes - I think, if I did see a path forward… I might take it. Is that okay with you?
^Even if it means low pay, ‘wasting’ a business degree, not knowing when I can afford to get married or buy a house, and having to explain my life choices to our parents...
^Well honestly… it’s like you said, one step at a time.
^But jaan, I do know you have talent. So I think... if you really care about doing this, then take it as far as you can, so that you have no regrets.
aman_2_2_narration: ^Later that evening, at a new cafe called Cafe Resipi Alegria.
aman_2_2: ^Where on earth is Jothi? Nearly half an hour late. She keeps breaking records.
^Oh good, you got us the vindaloo! My favourite.
^Yes, I know the drill. But it’s all cold already.
^Okay bander (monkey), now you’re just sulking. Is something wrong?

b: ^Should I tell her about the rejections? She’ll just say ‘I-told-you-so.’
^But maybe that’s what I need to hear? If this is a fool’s dream, someone should tell me to snap out of it.
^Maybe I’ll sound her out. Jothi always says it like it is.

aman_2_2: ^So, I’ve been applying to as many casting calls as I can in the last month.
^Let me guess, you haven’t gotten a single audition.
^Because if they’d seen you act, they would have hired you.
^That’s nice of you to say, but you’re my sister.
^No Aman, I’m not saying it because I’m your sister, I’m saying it because it’s true.
^I’ve never seen a play with you in it that didn’t blow everyone away.
^So if you haven’t gotten a role yet, it’s because someone has decided that on paper, you don’t fit the mould.

c-0: ^Those were just crummy school productions, community events...
^Oh please, no need to be Mr Modesty around your sister. You know you’re talented, right?
^...Yes, fine, I think I’ve got something. But if I’m so great, why isn’t that enough to land me a role?
c-1: ^That’s nice of you to say, but whatever competence I might have on the stage isn’t helping me right now. It’s very frustrating.
^Why isn’t it enough to be good at what I do?
g-0: ^That’s a rhetorical question, right? You already know. But fine, I’ll answer it.
^You’re a smart boy Aman, going into business school and everything. So you know about demand and purchasing power.
^Think about the Singapore market. If a local drama is produced, who forms the majority of the audience watching it?
^And if a commercial is put out on the airwaves, and in the movie theatres, advertising - I don’t know, diamond rings - who do you think is going to be buying most of the diamond rings?

c-2: ^Well, yes. And these are mostly - by sheer numbers, not even talking about any other reasons - Chinese Singaporeans.

g-1: ^So now, I ask you. If you want to produce a project that achieves popular success… a project that moves audiences to relate with the hero or heroine, or convinces them to go buy diamond rings… who do you think you will cast?
^Wait, wait. If we go with that line of thinking, then everybody will just be watching films and reading books that feature people of their own race.
^And most of the time, don’t they? How many Chinese people do you know who are into Bollywood?
^What about Korean dramas and boy bands?
^Those have cult followings abroad, even in places like Indonesia. Even some Americans are diehard fans!
^So, it’s not true that people can only relate to characters who look or speak like them.
^Ah - so now we come to supply.
^Where was the Korean entertainment industry born? Where did it first achieve scale?
^Obviously, in Korea. Do you think Korean pop could have grown out of Singapore, or Indonesia, or the US?

c-4: ^ I see where you’re going, but this is completely defeatist. If we stick to this line of thinking, then are you saying minorities can never achieve success, because we are out-numbered?
^No, of course not! I agree with you, it would be defeatist and even dangerous to start thinking that way.
c-5: ^ What are you saying, then? Singapore is my home, but I should go to Bollywood?
^No! I can’t imagine leaving. I don’t want to. I shouldn’t have to make a choice like that.
^I don’t want to believe that minorities can’t succeed!
^Aman, calm down! I’m not saying that at all.

g-2: ^Obviously, there are plenty of Sikhs who are very successful in Singapore.
^In the military. In business. In the legal profession - and I’m biased because I’m married to him, but Kirpal is an example.
^But Aman, I’m just saying that in the arts and entertainment industry of all places, I think it will be harder for you to find prime roles.
^Not because people are evil and malicious, or out to block you from success. But because of human nature. And, frankly, because you have chosen to be you.
^A Sikh who wears the turban. Who keeps the kesh (unshorn hair).
^As an actor, you have to pretend to be someone else for a living. How many people look like you, with turbans and beards?
^No, obviously I know that. I mean, what are you trying to get at? What are you implying?
^Okay, you want me to say it?
^Your chances would be better if you looked just a tiny bit more like everyone else, Aman.
^If you could bend and compromise, more roles would open up to you.
^I’m not going down that route, Jothi. You know that faith is important to me.
^It’s important to me too, and to Kirpal. But you know our views on this.
^Sikhism is about service to others. Equality and justice. Learning to be a better person.
^Fine, we don’t keep the kesh (uncut hair). And yes, I know that decision hurts Papa-ji and mum. But we still live the values of Sikhism in our daily lives.
^That’s why Kirpal does all that pro bono work. And I… I’m not perfect, but I try in my own ways.
^We still go to the gurdwara. We will still raise our future children as Sikhs.
^Jothi, I know you’re coming from a place of love, but I’ll never do what you’re implying.
^For that matter - you know Papa-ji and mum are waiting and hoping for you to return to the path and keep the 'form' (uncut hair) again, right?
^Oh I know, trust me. And it is something we think about as well. We may get there one day, but in our own time.
^We’re all on our own journeys, right?
^Right. And on my journey, there are some compromises I just won’t make.
^I respect that, Aman. But this is the real world, and I have to ask.
^If succeeding in acting means you have to choose between your dream, and your faith, what will you do?

c-6: ^ If it really came to that, then I would give up the dream.
^If I were really backed into that corner, yes. Some things are more important.
^For all I’ve said today, I hope it doesn’t come to that.
c-7: ^ I refuse to make that choice. If we live in a world that makes us choose, then maybe we need to do something about the world.
^Hah. That’s my stubborn baby brother through and through.
^I despair for you sometimes Aman, but I’m proud of you all the same.

aman_2_2_1: ^What is Zhihao up to this time?

g-0: ^don’t even have to act la omg
^Sliightly obnoxious way to put it, but interesting.
^Sounds good! Yes, please send me the link

aman_2_2_2: ^That clown? You used to run around the void deck when you were kids and he would call you ‘the Singh fella’.
^Anyway, yes, it’s the same one. He can be a clown, but his intentions are not bad.
^He says he might have found me a role to try for.
^Really? What makes this role so special?
^I'll tell you if I get it

c-0: ^I can see your eyes being sceptical and all.
^Fine, I was thinking - Sikh policeman? A bit stereotypical no?
^But, I don’t want to be a wet blanket. Good luck, okay? They’d be fools not to give you the part.
c-1: ^Oh, I don’t want to jinx anything. I’ll tell you if I land it.
^Alright, keep me posted. For all the rain I poured on your parade today, you know I’m your number one fan, right?

aman_2_3_narration: ^I couldn't sleep well last night, because of the casting call today.
^This is it! Finally, make or break.
^I’ve gone through the lines they sent me a hundred times. Let’s see...
^“Now, listen closely. I’ve looked at the files, and I must say. Things don’t add up in your favour.”

^“It says here you’ve been hauled up before for love-scamming an old lady online, stealing grocery vouchers from your neighbour’s letter box, and performing illegal cosmetic surgery in the back room of a KTV lounge.”
^“That’s quite the chequered past you have, Mr Roger Tan.”
^“Your protestations are futile. Your time is simply up.”
aman_2_3: ^Hi Aman, I’m Alison! Okay, you’re up.
^Just stand there and face us over here… move a little to your left… perfect.
^For this first take, just do the lines according to your own interpretation of the role.

c-0: ^...A scary guy. These lines are ridiculous, but if I keep my eyes looking dead and my demeanour uninterested, I can actually make myself quite sinister.
c-1: ^...A ridiculous figure, over-inflated with his delusions of grandeur. This should be fun.
g-0: ^Let me go! You have no right to keep me here. I demand my rights as a citizen.

c-2: ^ I’ve looked at the files, and I must say.
c-3: ^ I’ve looked at the facts, and I must say.

g-1: ^Things don’t add up in your favour.
^It says here you’ve been hauled up before for love-scamming an old lady online, stealing grocery vouchers from your neighbour’s letter box, and performing illegal cosmetic surgery...

s: ^In the spare room of a KTV lounge.
^In the back room of a KTV lounge.

g-2: ^That’s quite the chequered past you have, Mr Roger...
g-3: ^I was framed! It was my ex. You have to believe me!
^Your protestations are futile. Your time is simply up.

b: ^Wow, that was great! And you nailed all the lines!
^Not bad, but you did trip up a bit on your lines. Do you need a minute to look at them again?
^No, sorry, I was just nervous! This is my first audition for a professional project.
^No worries - you still did a good job.
^It’s strange - we didn’t write that role to be a scary one at all, but you actually gave me chills. We haven’t seen it done that way before.
^Thank you, I’m so glad to hear that!
^I’m going to have to ask you to redo it in a more comical way though, because that’s what the scriptwriters intended.
^I loved your delivery, it was hilarious.
^Can we do just one more take?

g-3: ^Great. Can you do it with an accent too?
^An Indian accent, like a really strong one. And can you also do the head wobble? (Attempts to demonstrate.)
^Uh… just to confirm, the character is Singaporean, right?
^Oh, yes! But Singaporean Indian. This is just to make it more funny.
^The way Indians speak is funny? It’s not funny to me.
^Should I say something? But won’t that rule me out for the part?

aman_2_3a: ^I’m not sure this is very appropriate.
^Sorry if I offended you. But you see, this is just what the team has in mind for the tone of the scene, and the character.
^We have to think about what the audience would find amusing, so… it’s nothing personal, it’s a professional thing. I hope you understand.
^Of course, you don’t have to do anything you’re not comfortable with. It’s your choice.
^Why is it that so often, I find myself in situations where there are no good choices?

c-0: ^I feel like a fraud the whole time.
^Like I’m betraying someone by doing this.
^I can’t keep the resentment from seeping into my acting.
^I guess I’m not that good an actor after all.
^I leave... knowing that I didn’t get the part.
c-1: ^I do another take, but I do it my own way.
^But she doesn’t like that I’ve ignored her instructions, I can tell.
^I leave... knowing that I didn’t get the part.

aman_2_3b: ^I think there can be other, better ways to make the scene funny without resorting to this, if you don’t mind.
^Personally, I don’t think Indian accents are funny.
^Oh - hmm, that’s not what I was trying to say.
^I meant, the audience we have in mind for this drama would find that funny, so we are playing more to that kind of humour.
^Okay, but shouldn’t you be better than that?
^Oh god. I did not just tell a casting director how her television series can ‘be better’.
^Her face has changed completely. Wouldn’t be surprised if it turned 360 degrees and bit me right now.
^I know you don’t have much experience, but I can see that you have talent.
^However, no matter how talented you are, what we care about here is professionalism.
^You may not agree with the brief, but it’s the brief.
^Thank you for your time today, and we will make our decision in due course.
aman_2_3c: ^The moment passed, there was no time left to think.
^I tuned out my doubts and just did what was asked of me.
^Suddenly it was over, and she was beaming. Somehow I knew I had gotten the part.
^Is this what it feels like to succeed?
^Why do I feel a little empty?
^Like I’ve let myself and other people down?
^I had thought I would be happier than this.

aman_2_4: ^Do the accent and shake my head. Because it’s funny.
^Eh this kind of thing can post on social media
^Oh… nah I think that’s not my style 😅
^It’s not just that. I don’t want to be known as a troublemaker in the industry
^Maybe it would be viral for one week…
^But then the public will forget, while I get blacklisted forever.

b: ^They are the ones who should be ashamed not you
^Still… if I do get the role, maybe don’t watch this one 😳
^I’ll tell you if I ever do anything worth watching.
^I’m sure you will act in some amazing movies one day bro
^I don’t think I got the part.

c-0: ^She says my chances are poor, especially being Sikh.
^Is she right? Do you have a sense?
^Actually there ARE roles for minorities out there. But maybe not so many major ones?
^Tough to say for sure since I’m just starting out.
^There are a few roles that are open to minorities. Rare to find roles that are specifically for Sikhs
^That’s why I was quite excited about this one.
c-1: ^I’m not sure I want to continue
^What if that’s the problem, it’s a dream
^Don’t rush and decide now after one bad incident
g-0: ^I know he’s the kind of bro who will always be supportive no matter what.
^I appreciate his constant positivity in my life.
^Even if I’m wrong, I know he’ll back me up.
^What if I’m wrong? What if Jothi is right?
